result.execSummary:
The defendant John T. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay fine including costs at a rate of $100/mo commencing 4/15/15 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John T. Erickson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant John T. Erickson in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard plea of No Contest  to Felon in Possession of a Firearm. Ct. found plea was given FKVI, accepted plea, and found Def guilty of Felon in Possession of a Firearm.  Court found factual basis in the Crim. Compl./Info.  The Court heard from State and Defense and sentenced as follows:  $500 fine plus court costs. for a total of $1158.  Defendant will pay $100/mo by the 15th day of each month. DNA Sample to be provided.  30 days in DCJail if he fails to pay.
State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Gib Thompson.  DEF, John Erickson apprs in person along with Atty William Gergen.  Atty Gergen heard and requests matter be set for plea/sentencing.  Court grants.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess any firearms. Defendant shall turn over any firearms in his possession within 48 hours to the Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:03 - Defendant John T. Erickson in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $5000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not possess any firearms. Defendant shall turn over any firearms in his possession to the Sheriff's Dept within 48 hours.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
